parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Neither, nor, not even, and not. From ou and de; not however, i.e. Neither, nor, not even.
In need, needy, poor. From a compound of en and deo; deficient in.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: How much, how great, how many, as great as, as much. By reduplication from hos; as As.
A possessor, owner. From ktaomai; an owner.
A place, piece of land, field, property, estate. Diminutive of chora; a spot or plot of ground.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To sell, exchange, barter. Probably ultimately from pelomai; to barter, i.e. To sell.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To carry, bear, bring; I conduct, lead; perhaps: I make publicly known. A primary verb.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A price, honor. From tino; a value, i.e. Money paid, or valuables; by analogy, esteem, or the dignity itself.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Neuter Plural
str2: A reduplicated and prolonged form of prao; contracted from perao; to traffic, i.e. Dispose of as merchandise or into slavery.
